page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY The village was first mentioned in the Domesday Book in 1086,it was then called Burtone.It belonged to the estate of Geoffrey de Wirce, of Melton.In the Middle Ages a leper hospital was situated alongside the village and the village was known as Burton(e) Sancti Lazari. A lazar is a person affected by the disease of Leprosy. Many cottages used to have thatched roofs but today only one thatched roof remains. The oldest houses in the village are made of grey stone from Clipsham or the softer brown stone of Pickwell.Some of the old houses have been re-roofed or moderned completely.
